parameters.name: call
parameters.value:
Quarantine email:
Subject: $exec.subject
Sender: $exec.sender
VT score: $exec.vt_score
Detection ID: $exec.detection_id

parameters.description: The password to log in with SMTP
parameters.name: password

parameters.description: The port to use for SMTP
parameters.name: smtp_port
subject
parameters.example: This is a subject, hello there :)

parameters.description: The body to add to the email
parameters.name: body
parameters.example: This is an email alert from Shuffler.io :)
parameters.value:
PhishGuard Alert - Phishing Detected

Detection summary
  • Source: $exec.source
  • ML verdict: $exec.ml_verdict (label=$exec.ml_label_raw)
  • Subject: $exec.subject
  • Sender: $exec.sender
  • VirusTotal score: $exec.vt_score
  • MISP indicator: $exec.misp_results.#.indicator
  • MISP match found: $exec.misp_results.#.found
  • Detection ID: $exec.detection_id
  • Email ID: $exec.email_id
  • S3 key: $exec.s3_key
  • Timestamp: $exec.timestamp
Email body (excerpt)
$exec.body

Recommended actions
  1. Quarantine or remove the email from the user inbox (if delivered).
  2. Block any malicious URLs/domains found in the email content.
  3. Search for similar emails (same subject/sender/URL) across mailboxes.
  4. Escalate to SOC/IT if multiple users are affected.

Note
This is an automated notification generated by PhishGuard (Shuffle SOAR).

parameters.description: Send files from shuffle as part of the email
parameters.name: attachments

parameters.description: Whether to use TLS or not
parameters.name: ssl_verify

parameters.description: The type of body to send. HTML by default
parameters.name: body_type

actions.description: Runs python with the data input. Any prints will be returned.
actions.label: Risk_Decision
actions.name: execute_python

parameters.description: The code to run. Can be a file ID from within Shuffle.
parameters.name: code

triggers.name: Webhook

errors: Trigger Webhook needs to be started
